source.name: q8
source.instructions:
In your AWS environment, you have an instance located in Availability Zone A (AZ-A) within a private subnet.
You have also set up a NAT Gateway in Availability Zone B (AZ-B) to handle outbound internet traffic for instances located in private subnets.
The NAT Gateway has the appropriate routes and configurations.
You observe that the EC2 instance in AZ-A is experiencing significant outbound traffic to the internet. 

How can you design a cost-optimized architecture to handle this outbound traffic efficiently?

answers.answer: Replace the NAT Gateway with a NAT instance for cost savings.
Use a VPC Endpoint to route the outbound traffic directly to the internet without incurring NAT Gateway costs.
Configure a public subnet with the NAT gateway in AZ-A.
Deploy an internet-facing Elastic Load Balancer (ELB) in front of the EC2 instance to handle the outbound traffic.
